Vida Vacations Resort at Vallarta Nayarit Featured in Upcoming Season Finale of ABC’s Bachelor In Paradise
Vidanta resort at Vallarta Nayarit, a premier luxury beach destination from Vida Vacations, will be featured in the upcoming season finale episodes of ABC’s summer reality series Bachelor in Paradise. One lucky couple will enjoy intimate experiences at the award-winning Vida Vacations’ Grand Luxxe resort including a romantic overnight date in a “Fantasy Suite” Grand Luxxe Residence Loft. The episodes are scheduled to air Sunday and Monday, September 6th and 7th, 2015, at 8/7c on ABC.
The contestants will spend the night in the ultimate lap of luxury in one of Vida Vacations’ Grand Luxxe three bedroom lofts. Each loft includes standard amenities such as a kitchen, breakfast bar, laundry room with washer and dryer, dining table, and living room with TV. The sumptuous living accommodations have three bedrooms, featuring a total of two king-size beds and two double beds, as well as three-and-a-half bathrooms, including two Jacuzzi tubs. Each unit is draped in fine linens and features marble, granite and fine stonework throughout to create the ultimate romantic getaway location.Not to be outdone by the interior, the lavish terrace includes an inviting, private dipping pool, dining table to experience majestic sunrises and sunsets, as well as daybeds and chairs to unwind after a long day in paradise. The suites are the epitome of elegance, which can only be created by Vida Vacations.
From the creator of The Bachelor franchise, summer series Bachelor in Paradise features some of The Bachelor’s biggest stars and most talked about villains in the history of the show. They all left The Bachelor or The Bachelorette scorned by the people they loved, and on Bachelor in Paradise they’ll get a second chance to find their soul mates. For six weeks, the group will live together in Mexico in an isolated romantic paradise and will explore new relationships, fall in love or be cast aside once more. The romantic dating series airs Sundays and Mondays on ABC.
The Grand Luxxe is a five-diamond resort with locations in both Riviera Maya and Nuevo Vallarta. Both locations offer lush gardens, superior accommodations and award winning cuisine by world renowned chefs and restauranteurs.
In addition to the spectacular entertainment and dining offerings at the Grand Luxxe resorts, guests at the Vidanta resort in Vallarta Nayarit can enjoy the Jack Nicklaus Academy of Golf and a Nicklaus Design golf course, Spatium spa services, private beaches and pools, as well as family friendly accommodations and amenities.
Source:-Vida Vacations Resort
